SpaceXs new Crew Dragon astronaut capsule will be ready for its first manned flight into orbit in the first quarter of next year provided everything goes according to plan in upcoming tests, NASA chief Jim Bridenstine said on Thursday.

articles.title: New NASA Satellite Called TESS Could Discover Thousands of New Planets - Mental Floss
articles.description: The new satellite follows on the heels of Kepler's discovery of more than 2,300 exoplanets over the last nine years.
articles.content:
Since NASAs Kepler spacecraft launched in 2009, the space agency has found and confirmed a whopping 2343 new planets. Of those, 30 are considered to be situated in a habitable zone, an area in which a planets surface could theoretically contain water.
